name: Ascensor Concepción
description: The city's oldest funicular. It connects the downtown area with the touristy Cerro Concepción.

name: La Sebastiana (Neruda's House)
description: One of the three houses belonging to the poet Pablo Neruda located on Cerro Florida.

name: Plaza Sotomayor
description: Valparaíso's main civic center, facing the port and surrounded by historic buildings.

name: Paseo 21 de Mayo
description: A viewpoint located on Cerro Playa Ancha, known for its panoramic views of the port and the bay.

name: Museo Naval y Marítimo
description: Located on Paseo 21 de Mayo, it narrates the Chilean naval history.

name: Cerro Alegre
description: Famous for its murals, colorful houses, and art galleries, was declared World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 2003.

name: Barrio Puerto
description: The oldest sector of the city, famous for its colonial architecture and traditional markets.
